title: Biggest Gains in Customer Satisfaction in the Management Top 250; Kimco Realty, L3Harris Technologies and LyondellBasell Industries head the list
text:
Kimco's score for customer satisfaction rose 15.3 points from the previous year, to 64. L3Harris's score in this category climbed 14.7 points to 50.3 and LyondellBasell's score rose 14.4 points to 51.4.

EXPLORE THE MANAGEMENT TOP 250

* See how all the ranked companies perform across five areas.

* See the full Management Top 250 Report

Among the Management Top 250 companies with the 10 biggest increases in customer-satisfaction scores, International Flavors & Fragrances Inc. has the highest score for the category, at 73.4, up 10.5 points from the previous year. That puts IFF in the top 10 for the category in the Management Top 250. The company ranks No. 76 overall, second in this group to Pfizer Inc., No. 27 overall. Pfizer's customer-satisfaction score rose 10.3 points to 62.5.

Dow Inc., No. 6 on this list of biggest gains in customer-satisfaction scores, also had one of the 10 biggest gains in overall score among the Management Top 250, and one of the 10 biggest gains for social responsibility.

You can explore the full, detailed rankings here, and a list of this year's eight All-Stars—companies that excelled in all five ranking components—here. In the coming weeks we'll take a look at the top gainers in financial strength, innovation, and employee engagement and development.

—Gerard Yates
